Package dbdiffchecker

Class FileHandler

java.lang.Object
dbdiffchecker.FileHandler
public class FileHandler
extends java.lang.Object
Deals with all data coming from and going out to files.
Since:
9-12-17

  • Method Details

    • serializeDatabase

      public static void serializeDatabase​(Database database, java.lang.String prefix) throws DatabaseDifferenceCheckerException
      Serializes a database with all of its table and view data.
      Parameters:
      database - The database to serialize.
      prefix - The prefix of the database snapshot to deserailize. Note: it is the name of the database implimentation of the database
      Throws:
      DatabaseDifferenceCheckerException - Error serializing the database.

    • writeToFile

      public static void writeToFile​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> sequelStatements) throws DatabaseDifferenceCheckerException
      Takes SQL statements and writes them to the last run file.
      Parameters:
      sequelStatements - Statements to be logged.
      Throws:
      DatabaseDifferenceCheckerException - Error writing the statements to the last run file.

    • writeToFile

      public static void writeToFile​(java.lang.String data) throws DatabaseDifferenceCheckerException
      Takes a String and writes it to the log file.
      Parameters:
      data - The data to be written to the log file.
      Throws:
      DatabaseDifferenceCheckerException - Error writing the data to the log file.

    • deserailizDatabase

      public static Database deserailizDatabase​(java.lang.String prefix) throws DatabaseDifferenceCheckerException
      Deserializes a database file.
      Parameters:
      prefix - The prefix of the database snapshot to deserailize. Note: it is the name of the database implimentation of the database
      Returns:
      The database created through deserialization with table and view data.
      Throws:
      DatabaseDifferenceCheckerException - Error deserializing the database file.

    • readFrom

      public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> readFrom​(java.lang.String file) throws DatabaseDifferenceCheckerException
      Returns the contents of the specified file.
      Parameters:
      file - The name of the file to be read from.
      Returns:
      Data that was stored in the file that was read from.
      Throws:
      DatabaseDifferenceCheckerException - Error reading in the data from the specified file.

    • fileExists

      public static boolean fileExists​(java.lang.String file)
      Takes a file path and determines whether the file exists or not.
      Parameters:
      file - The file path to the file.
      Returns:
      Whether the file exists or not.
      See Also:
      https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1816673/how-do-i-check-if-a-file-exists-in-java
